result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • William D Pongratz was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $900.00 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

With Huber and Good Time Credit. Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.  Court does not object to a jail transfer.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Pongratz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #1-#11 (Exhibit #4 withdrawn, #5 & #8 not able to be scanned-DVD & Blood draw Kit)

8:21 am case called. Defendant William D Pongratz in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No pre-trial motions to be addressed. Statement by DA Blader regarding photos shared with the defense. Sequestration order entered. 8:35 Entire panel sworn. Voir Dire begins 9:28 Peremtory Challenges begin. Impaneld jurors sworn by clerk. Statement by Attorney Schmidt regarding listings provided to counsel. 10:00 case recalled, same appearances. 10:08 am Opening Statements. 10:27 am Sequestration order takes effect. State's case in chief. State calls Gerald Major, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #1 offered and received, #5 offered and received, Cross exam by Attorney Schmidt. Exhibit #6. Witness excused. State calls Officer Ron Piechowski, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross exam. Witness excused. State calls Officer Ryan McElroy, witness sworn, testimony given. Record reflects positive identification of defendant. Exhibit #7, #8, #9 offered and received. Exhibit #2, #3, & #4 offered and received. 11:56 Court breaks for lunch. 1:00 pm case recalled, same appearances. Jury returned to the courtroom. Cross exam by Attorney Schmidt. Exhibit #10, Re-direct by DA Blader. Re-Cross by Attorney Schmidt. 1:40 pm calls State calls Rodney Wiedmann Jr., witness sworn, testimony given. Cross by Attorney Schmidt. 1:49 pm State calls Lorrine Edwards, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross Exam by Attorney Schmidt. Witness excused. State rests. 2:35 pm Jury removed from courtroom. Court questions Attorney Schmidt regarding testimony of the defendant. Court addresses defendant's 5th & 6th Amendment rights. Court questions defendant and accepts the defendant's right to testify-knowing, voluntary, and intelligent waiver of 5th amendment right and accepts the defendants right to exercise his 6th amendment right. 3:13 pm case recalled, same appearances. Attorney Schmidt calls William Pongratz, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross exam by DA Blader. Defense rests. Court questions State regarding rebutall evidence. No rebuttal evidence. 3:50 pm Evidence closed. Instruction conference held. 4:01 pm Jury returned to the courtroom. Jury instructions read-Closing arguments-final instructions-bailiffs charged. 5:05 pm Jury excused to jury room to begin deliberations. 5:45 pm case recalled-same appearances. Verdict reached & jury returned to courtroom. Court questions foreperson and reads verdict. Jury finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1 & Guilty of Count 2. Court polls jury and confirms verdict of each juror and the jury as a whole. 5:55 pm Jury dismissed and thanked for their service. 6:00 pm State moves for JOC upon the verdict. Court enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Schmidt. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 90 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. To begin immediately. 48 hour rule. Court does not object to jail transfer.  $2669.00 fine plus $42.50 blood draw costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court applies bond. 32 month DL Revocation. 32 month IID effective today, OWI Assessment.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
State's Scientific Principles and Realiability in Support of Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus (HGN)

Case Called @ 10:15 AM: Defendant William D Pongratz in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In advance of the hearing the State had filed documentation as to HGN issue.  Counsel agree no HGN issue exists.  As materials were previously filed to remain as filed earlier today.  Not an issue for trial however.  Court has reviewed pre-trial motions filed.  Court will grant the State's motion in limine with the exception of paragraph 8 which refers to s. 906.09 issue.   Court will address separately.  Argument by State as to field sobriety testing.  Argument by Atty Schmidt - constitutional right to not submit to those tests.  Does not agree with the right of the State of offer into evidence.  The Court:  Not an arguable Miranda issue - 5th Amendment concern would not yet be invoked.  State is entitled to present evidence as to investigative process.  State will be allowed to introduce evidence concerning field exercises undertaken.  State is permitted to introduce evidence of the entirety of the interaction with the officer and Defendant and Def's response.  No 907.01 v. 907.02 issues.  General approach explained at trial - no reference as to scientific reliability.  Defendant would be entitled to introduce evidence as to informant report and will not be construed as an alibi issue.  As to 906.09 motion - Should Def choose to testify, State will be permitted to question Def as to prior convictions.   Defendant understands nature of testimony and number of convictions if asked.   As to Old Chief Stipulation:  Colloquy undertaken and Court accepts stipulation as to 2 prior convictions - State is relieved of the obligation to prove said offenses.  Specific reference recited as to Wood Co Case and Washington Co Case.  Court permits entry of Old Chief Stipulation.  State is in compliance with NCIC documentation provided as per State's witness list.  Defense has not provided a witness list.  Per Atty Schmidt - only potential witness may be Defendant.  Proposed JI discussed.   Court will require standard Jury Pool - 13 impaneled - 4 pre-emptive strikes.  21 in box - 13 plus 8.  32 jurors to be summoned.  State recites offer extended which was rejected.   Secondary offer also recited which was also rejected.  Counsel and Defendant concur with State's recitals on offers extended.  Defendant confirms rejection.  Court advises Defendant on the immediate reporting requirement on a guilty finding.
Final pre-trial on July 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Schmidt Re: Request to Adjourn FPT on 7/1/2016
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions

Final pre-trial on July 1, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Jury trial on August 4, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Case called @ 1:40 p.m. Defendant William D Pongratz in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Schmidt requesting a jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 01:45 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Schmidt requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

10:19 am case called. Defendant William D Pongratz in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Suppression hearing to proceed. State calls Officer Ryan McElroy, witness sworn, testimony given. Record reflects positive identification of defendant. Cross exam by Attorney Schmidt, testimony given. 10:44 am witness excused. Attorney Schmidt calls William D. Pongratz, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross exam by ADA Anderson, testimony given. 10:48 am witness excused. Argument by Attorney Schmidt. Argument by ADA Anderson. Court makes statement to counsel-clear and convincing evidence for the stop and arrest.  Court denies motion to suppress.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Suppression/Dismissal

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Schmidt requesting a suppression hearing and possibly a collateral attack motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 3:15 PM: Defendant William D Pongratz in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel  and states he will retain his own counsel, expects to retain Leon Schmidt of Schmidt & Grace.  Retainer fee expected to be paid this week.  Court will proceed with the understanding that counsel will be retained.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
